Description:
Job SummaryThe Data Quality Assurance Analyst's main focus is on developing Data Governance policies, enforcing them, documenting data in Data Catalog, developing Data Governance metrics, assisting Data Architect in developing Data Models and discovering data sources.Key AccountabilitiesDevelop Data Governance policies around: data lifecycle, data retention, model governance, regulatory reporting, business reporting, data documentation, data quality, metadata management, data classification.
Ensure Data Governance policies are addressed to responsible units: business, IT, Operations, Risk, Compliance.
Develop Data Governance metrics and monitor them.
Make sure Data Governance KPI’s are met within assigned domain.
Document Data Assets in Data Catalog, ensure Data Lineage is accurate.
Discover and document data in Source Systems. Assist Data Architects in developing Data Models.
Communicate with Source system owners, Project Management Office, Data Team and Business units to ensure documentation in Data Catalog is correct and up to date.Skills
Skills:
Business Analytics
Data Quality
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and attention to details

SQL – Advanced user (Stored Procedures, Window functions, Temp Tables, Recursive Queries)
Python – Basic Automation
Knowledge (at least one of) DQ platforms is a plus: IBM WKC+DataStage, Ataccama DQ, Infomatica DQ Platform

Experience either with Technical Stack mentioned and/or one of the Business domains within bank – Retail/Wholesale/Risk/Finance/Compliance etc.
Understanding of the process of creating the reporting.
Experience in Finance/Banking is a plus
Experience with data governance and data quality tools is a plus.

Adaptability/Flexibility
Creativity/Innovation
Decision Making/Judgment
Dependability
Initiative
Integrity/Ethics
Problem Solving/Analysis

Ability to interact with internal and external stakeholders
Ability to work under pressure
Accuracy and attention to detail
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent
